newsitem.title: FINLAND: FINNISH BONDS END FIRM AFTER LOW U.S. PPI DATA.
newsitem.headline: FINNISH BONDS END FIRM AFTER LOW U.S. PPI DATA.

text.p: 1700/1400 GMT - Bonds end clearly firmer after strong
sentiment abroad and under-forecast U.S PPI figures. Late
profit-taking in mark and markka saps some of the momentum,
dealers say. Upcoming EU summit seen giving direction for yield
gap over Bunds. * DEM/FIM seen in 2.98-3.02 range.
*FIM-06 yld pct 6.03 vs 6.10 *06 gap over Bund bps 32 vs 36
*FIM-04 yld pct 5.61 vs 5.69 *FIM-99 yld pct 3.67 vs 3.68
*Jun FRAs 3.06 pct vs 3.06 *March FRAs 3.70 pct vs 3.73
*SEK/FIM 0.6688 vs 0.6640 *ECU index 100.51 vs 100.49
Finnish bonds ended clearly
firmer on Friday, helped by a low inflation signal from the
U.S. PPI figure and upbeat sentiment abroad, dealers said.
The benchmark 2006 bond yield fell 7 bps to 6.03.
" A drop of over six basis points has a psychological
effect and made the markets optimistic," one dealer said.
Overall, the markets were seen focusing on the EU's
Amsterdam summit next week, which dealers said could point the
way to further narrowing of Finland's yield gap to Germany if
the meeting succeeds.
--Helsinki Newsroom +358-9-680 50 235
